audio_item.dc.title: Sound Recording - University of Michigan Men's Glee Club 108th Annual Spring Concert - 1967 April 01
audio_item.dc.contributor.author: University of Michigan. Men's Glee Club
audio_item.dc.rights.access: This material is available for research only in the Reading Room of the Bentley Historical Library at the University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI).
audio_item.dc.rights.copyright: This recording may be protected by copyright law. Every audio, visual, or textual work has copyright protection unless that protection has expired over time or its creator has placed it in the public domain. It is the responsibility of anyone interested in reproducing, broadcasting or publishing content from the Bentley Historical Library collections to determine copyright holders and secure permissions accordingly.
audio_item.dc.description: Content note: The sound recording(s) associated with this repository item derive from a single audio reel tape. A single tape may yield multiple audio files if there were variations in tape stock, speed, or channels (i.e. stereo or mono). For more information see http://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/handle/2027.42/108126.
audio_item.dc.abstract: [Program 39] : [Side 1] : [Part 1] : Tape 2 of 2; Selections performed include: Speak to Me of Love; What is this Thing Called Love?; Love is the Sweetest Thing; Love is a Many Splendored Thing; Love is a Simple Thing; Would You Like to Take a Walk?; Strange Music; I Met a Girl; Soft Lights and Sweet Music; 'S Wonderful 'S Marvelous; Our Love is Here to Stay; Love is Sweeping the Country; Selections by The Friars: If I could Write a Symphony, Mr. Bass Man, Encore, I am Only Eighteen; Michigan Songs: Michigan Medley, Michigan Men; Goddess of the Inland Seas; Bum Army; Go Blue; Old Friars Song; Varsity and Victors; The Yellow and Blue.
